ContentDistributionView.name: ContentDistributionView
ContentDistributionView.description: Represents information about views of a shared document.

DistributionId.description: ID of the content delivery that the document is part of.

IsDownload.description: true if the shared document is downloaded; false if the shared document is viewed.

IsInternal.description: true if the shared document is viewed by a user in the same organization; false if viewed by an external user.

ParentViewId.description: ID of this instance of accessing the shared document.

ContentDistributionView.accessRules: Content deliveries must be enabled to query content deliveries. Users (including users with the “View All Data” permission) can query only the files that they have access to. If the file is managed by a Content Library, the user must have “Deliver Content” enabled in the library permission definition and be a member of the library. If the file isn’t managed by a Content Library, the user must have the “Enable Creation of Content Deliveries for Salesforce Files” permission. ContentDistributionView can be deleted by an admin. If the shared document is deleted, the delete cascades to any associated ContentDistributionView. The ContentDistributionView is still queryable by using the QueryAll verb. Customer Portal users can’t access this object. Chatter Free users can’t access this object.
